subtitle: Your guide through Belgian administration
questionsTitle: A few questions about your situation
congratulationsMessage: You have completed all your tasks! Good luck on your journey in Belgium.

europeanID.question: Do you have a valid European ID or passport?
options: Yes, I have a European ID or passport
No, I only have a non-EU document

contract.question: Do you already have a signed employment contract?

plukkaart.question: Do you have a plukkaart (seasonal work permit)?
options: No, I still need to get it
I don't know what that is

previousWork.question: Have you previously worked as a seasonal worker in Belgium within the last 5 years?

duration.question: How long do you plan to work in Belgium?

options: No, I need to get one

options: No, I need to open one

municipality.title: Municipal Registration
municipality.description: You need to register where you live in Belgium. This is your official entry into the system.
steps: Go to your local municipality office
Give your personal details (work contract & address)
Wait for the police to verify your residence
Return to complete the registration once approved
municipality.estimatedTime: 1-2 hours (plus waiting time for police check)

contract.title: Employment Contract & Plukkaart
contract.description: Get your official work contract signed and ask for your plukkaart (work permit for seasonal jobs).
steps: Meet with your employer to receive your contract
Read it carefully (ask for help if needed!)
Sign the contract
Ask your employer to apply for your plukkaart
Keep both documents safe (digitally too)

health.title: Health Insurance (Mutualiteit)
health.description: Belgium requires everyone to be insured for medical care. This can be through your employer or a mutualiteit.
steps: Ask your employer if health insurance is included
If not, choose a health fund (CM, Helan, Partena, etc.)
Go to their office or register online
Provide necessary documents and wait for confirmation

bijlage3.title: Temporary Residence Document (Bijlage 3)
bijlage3.description: You receive this document after your municipal registration. This documents allows you to live and work in Belgium legally.
steps: After registering at the municipality, ask for Bijlage 3
Wait for processing time
Pick up the document or receive it via mail

bank.title: Bank Account
bank.description: Open a Belgian bank account, if you want but this is not mandatory. It makes receiving your salary faster and easier.
steps: Choose a bank (Belfius, KBC, ING, BNP Paribas, etc.)
Visit a nearby branch or start the online process
Show required documents and confirm your identity
Activate your account and mobile banking app

medicalCheck.title: Medical Check-up
medicalCheck.description: A medical exam may be required to confirm you are fit for work. This can be provided by your employer or done independently.
steps: Schedule an appointment with a certified medical doctor
Go to your check-up and get a medical certificate
Submit the certificate to your employer or relevant authority

noEUMessage: This app is currently only available for people with European IDs. The option for non-European people is not out yet.
